title: Gowanus Canal
summary: The Gowanus Canal (originally known as the Gowanus Creek) is a 1.8-mile-long (2.9Â km) canal in the New York City borough of Brooklyn, on the westernmost portion of Long Island. Once a vital cargo transportation hub, the canal has seen decreasing use since the mid-20th century, parallel with the decline of domestic waterborne shipping. It continues to be used for occasional movement of goods and daily navigation of small boats, tugs and barges.
